p: Human activities, including the combustion of fossil fuels in vehicles, power plants, and many industrial processes [ 10], can also generate significant amounts of particulates. Coal combustion in developing countries is the primary means to generate energy and heat homes. Although salt spray is the most common form of particulate in the atmosphere over the oceans, anthropogenic aerosols, i.e. those that are generated by human activities, currently account for about 10% of the total mass of aerosols in the atmosphere [ 11].
